intro: Papuacalia sandsii, commonly known as the sandstone cactus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing, succulent perennial that thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features fleshy, spiny stems that store water, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Papuacalia sandsii is well adapted to extreme environments, making it a resilient and unique member of its ecosystem.
